title: Number Checker
subtitle: Check if a number is prime, even, or odd
description: A powerful extension that helps you check various properties of numbers. Features include prime number checking, even/odd detection, and more mathematical utilities.

documentation.title: Available Blocks
documentation.content:
1. IsPrime(number) - Returns true if the number is prime
2. IsEven(number) - Returns true if the number is even
3. IsOdd(number) - Returns true if the number is odd

title: Islamic History
subtitle: Hijri date for Muslims and Islamic history utilities
description: A comprehensive extension for Islamic applications. Features include Hijri date conversion, prayer times, and Islamic history events.

documentation.title: Available Blocks
documentation.content:
TodayHijri(year, month, day)

Returns the Hijri (Islamic) date for a given Gregorian date.

Parameters:
• year (integer): Gregorian year (e.g., 2024)
• month (integer): Gregorian month (1-12)
• day (integer): Gregorian day (1-31)

Returns:
• List with Hijri year, month, and day.

title: Device Year
subtitle: Analyze device specs and estimate its high-end release year.
description: This extension analyzes your Android device's hardware specifications—such as CPU cores, memory, and maximum CPU frequency—and estimates the year in which the device would have been considered high-end. Useful for benchmarking, device classification, and performance-aware app features.

documentation.title: All Blocks Description
documentation.content:
• DeviceYear: Returns the estimated year (as integer) the device would be considered 'high end'.
  • NumberOfCPUCores: Returns the number of CPU cores (integer).
  • TotalMemory: Returns the total device memory in bytes (integer).
  • CPUMaxFreqKHz: Returns the maximum CPU frequency in KHz (integer).

title: Similarity
subtitle: Check if two strings are similar
description: An extension component to calculate the similarity score between two strings. A score of 0.0 means the strings are completely dissimilar, while 1.0 means they are identical. Values in between indicate the degree of similarity. Supports multiple algorithms for flexible comparison.

documentation.title: Features
documentation.content:
- feature: String to compare
- target: String to compare against
- algorithm: Selectable property

documentation.title: Supported Algorithms
documentation.content:
1. JaroSimilarity
2. JaroWinklerSimilarity
3. LevenshteinDistance
4. DiceCoefficient
Returns a similarity score between 0.0 and 1.0.

documentation.title: Error Handling
documentation.content:
ErrorOccurred(error, from)
Error return and source.

documentation.title: Demo Blocks
documentation.content: In this demo I am trying to find out the similarities between McMahons and McDonald's by algorithm Jaro
